name: Almoravids
startIntroPart1: Great Emir, the people of Morocco need you! Your beginnings stem from a tribal confederation, whose story is the fundamental legacy of all Morocco. Under your guidance, you founded the cultural center of Marrakesh, won key territories in Al-Andulus at the Battle of Sagrajas and recognised the Abbasid Caliph's supremacy. Your diplomatic skills and humanity allowed you to successfully build the empire, despite having to give over rule of the southern half of the empire to Abu Bakr ibn Umar and his descendants, and made for an empire tolerant of non-Muslims through the law of dhimmi.
startIntroPart2: Wise and tolerant Emir, your people look to you for leadership, and for you to expand upon the work which was so soon finished. Can you build a civilization that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: As I once united the Maghreb and Al-Andulus, now I shall unite our lands!
attacked: A shame that it has come to this.
defeated: My legacy will live far longer than I.
denounced: I can't take such remarks seriously.
introduction: My name is Yusuf ibn Tashfin, I welcome you on behalf of the Almoravids.
tradeRequest: I came with all hope, but haven't reached an agreement.
uniqueName: Connector of the Sand and Water Seas
uniqueText:
+50% [Gold] from Trade Routes
+1 [Culture], +1 [Gold] from each Trade Route per era
+1 [Faith] from each Trade Route per era, ending after the Classical era

name: Armenia
startIntroPart1: Welcome, O magnificent and enlightened King Tiridates III, descendant of the great and ancient Kingship of Armenia. Your country's history stretches far back, its origins tracing from the northernmost satrapies of the mighty Achaemenid Dynasty. For centuries, the Kingdom lay at the crossroads of power, between the two empires of Rome in the West and Parthinia in the East, who would wage bloody war for the right to subjugate her beneath them. In the 3rd century AD, the throne of Armenian Kings would fall to the occupation of the Sassanid Persians, successors of Parthia, but, with the aid of the Roman Emperor Aurelian, it would be restored unto you, Armenia's rightful King. As her King, you would first throw Gregory the Illuminator into prison for 14 years, yet he would escape with your sister's help and convert you to Christianity, leading you to proclaim Armenia's devotion as the first Christian state in the world, several dozen years prior the proclamation of Constantine the Great.
startIntroPart2: Wise Prince, the Kingdom of Armenia must rise once more, and with it must come the defense of the faith that you would call your own. Can you bring to the Armenian people great piety and power immeasurable? Can you carve an empire into the mountains that rise to the heavens above your Kingdom? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: The angels's trumpet has blown! The holy blades of my soldiers shall be your demise!
attacked: You wish to disturb our peace? Then come, let's see if you have the will to destroy my kingdom!
defeated: Has God decided to forsaken us?
introduction: Do you serve the same God as I do? Or are you just another heretic?
tradeRequest: Perhaps we should exchange resources, for the better of our kingdoms.
uniques: [Mounted] units gain the [Nisean Mounts] promotion
[+1 Food, +1 Production, +1 Faith] from every [Mountain]
[+3 Faith] [in capital] <after founding a Pantheon> <before founding a religion>

name: Byzantium
startIntroPart1: Greetings, Emperor Justinian!
startIntroPart2: Rebuild the greatest empire to ever grace the Mediterranean!
declaringWar: God wills it
attacked: May God have mercy on you, for I will not
defeated: I'll see you in the afterlife
introduction: Greetings!
hateNo: We are not agreeing to that!
tradeRequest: We bestow you the honor of this trade offer.
uniqueText:
May buy [Cathedral], [Mosque], [Pagoda] and [Stupa] buildings with [Faith] without needing their respective religious belief
+10% [Science] in Capital when all 4 are built

name: Carthage
startIntroPart1: Greetings to you, revered Queen Dido, ruler of the legendary kingdom of Carthage. The great poet Virgil related your great history, how your husband Acerbas was murdered by your own brother, King Pygmalion of Tyre, to steal the treasures of your family that were rightfully yours. But you endured his pressure until you and your compatriots decided to flee and sail for new lands. The gods led you to the shores of North Africa, and with cunning diplomacy, you expanded the territory of your new home, and laid the basis for the future kingdom of Carthage.
startIntroPart2: Clever and proud Dido, the storm is coming and your people look for a shelter under your wise and powerful protection. Can you create a new and radiant Carthage able to cleave the darkness? Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: Tell me, do you all know how numerous my armies, elephants and the gdadons are? No? Today, you shall find out!
attacked: Fate is against you. You earned the animosity of Carthage in your exploration. Your days are numbered.
defeated: The fates became to hate me. This is it? You wouldn't destroy us so without their help.
denounced: You aren't meeting my expectations. You can do so much better.
introduction: The Phoenicians welcome you to this most pleasant kingdom. I am Dido, the queen of Carthage and all that belongs to it.
tradeRequest: I just had the marvelous idea, and I think you'll appreciate it too.
uniqueText:
Maritime buildings are built in half the usual time
+1 [Gold] in capital for every maritime building you have constructed
Civilian units only pay 1 Movement point when embarking or disembarking
uniques: [1] Movement point cost to embark <for [Civilian] units>
[1] Movement point cost to disembark <for [Civilian] units>

[+100]% Production when constructing [Harbor] buildings [in all cities]
[+100]% Production when constructing [Seaport] buildings [in all cities]

[+1 Gold] [in capital] <for every [[Harbor] Buildings]>
[+1 Gold] [in capital] <for every [[Seaport] Buildings]>

name: Crusader States
startIntroPart1: Greetings, mighty Baldwin I! The Counties of Edessa and Tripoli, Principality of Antioch and Kingdom of Jerusalem call await your command.
startIntroPart2: May you lead the 4 Crusader States into glory!
declaringWar: For the Lord!
attacked: I'll see you twice; once on the battlefield and once in Hell!
defeated: Will I rise or fall?
introduction: Greetings!
hateHello: Speak quickly, for I have more important issues to attend to.
hateNo: A better deal would be offered from Satan himself.
tradeRequest: We bestow you the honor of this trade offer.
uniqueText:
Free [Swordsman] and [Settler] appears upon discovering Mathematics
Free [Knight] and [Settler] appears upon discovering Chivalry
Land units +15% strength and +100% maintenance costs
May purchase Great Generals for 600/1000/2200 [Gold] from the Ancient/Renaissance/Modern eras

[+150]% maintenance costs <for [{Military} {Land}] units>

Free [Swordsman] appears <upon discovering [Mathematics] technology>
Free [Settler] appears <upon discovering [Chivalry] technology>
Free [Knight] appears <upon discovering [Chivalry] technology>

name: Denmark
startIntroPart1: Honor and glory be yours, Harald Bluetooth Gormsson, mighty heir of King Gorm of the Old and Thryra Dannebod. Not only were you victorious on the battlefield against the armies of Norway, you also completed massive construction project across the land - numerous Ring Fortresses to protect the populace from invasion and internal strife. You successfully drove off waves of German settlers in 983 AD and sheltered your kingdom from unwanted foreign influence.
startIntroPart2: Stalwart Viking, the time for greatness is upon you once more. You are called to rise up and lead your people to renewed power and trumph! Will you make the world shudder once more at the very thought of your great armies of the Northsmen? Will you let the Viking battle cry ring out across the crashing waved? Will you build a civilization to stand the test of time?
declaringWar: If I am to be honest, I tire of those pointless charades. Why don't we settle our disputes on the field of battle, like true men? Perhaps the skalds will sing of your valor... or mine!
attacked: Ahahah! You seem to show some skills of a true Viking! Too bad that I'll probably kill you!
defeated: Loki must have stood by you, for a common man alone could not have defeated me... Oh well! I will join the einherjar in Valhalla and feast, while you toil away here.
introduction: Harad Bluetooth bids you welcome to his lands, a Viking unlike any the seas and lands have ever known! Hah, are you afraid?
tradeRequest: This is a fine deal! Even a drunk beggar would agree!
uniques: [+1 Production] from every [Fish]
[+2] Movement <for [Embarked] units>
[1] Movement point cost to disembark <for [All] units>
No movement cost to pillage <for [Melee] units>
No movement cost to pillage <for [Water] units>
[{Military} {Water}] units gain the [Landing Party] promotion

name: England
startIntroPart1: Long live to Your Highness, Queen Elizabeth Gloriana, leader and protector of the glorious England! Through history, enduring many invasions, England strengthened its will, playing smartly with diplomacy, cunning, and military power, to eventually rose as one of the most dominant Empires the world has ever known. Their matchless navy, brilliant scientists and artists, and powerful merchants, have shaped the known world for centuries.
startIntroPart2: Queen Elizabeth, will England cast once more its brightness upon all lands and seas of the world? Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: By the grace of God, your days are numbered.
attacked: We shall never surrender.
defeated: You have triumphed over us. The day is yours.
denounced: Your reckless pride will destroy you if you're not careful.
introduction: We are pleased to meet you.
tradeRequest: Would you be interested in a trade agreement with England?
uniques: [+2] Movement <for [Water] units>
[+2] Movement <for [Embarked] units>
Gain an extra spy <upon entering the [Renaissance era]> <when espionage is enabled>
[+50]% Production when constructing [Courthouse] buildings [in all cities] <when espionage is disabled>

name: Germany
startIntroPart1: All hail to Otto von Bismarck, first chancellor of Germany and its empire! During the ancient era, Germany was a land fragmented in several tribes but already showed great promise as the Roman Empire itself struggled to bend the Germans to its will. Germany, as one nation, was slowly built on the ruins of the Holy Roman Empire, and waited 1871 to be finally unified after the glorious victory on France and Napoleon III. The German people are creative, intelligent, industrious and proven to be talented warriors through history. Despite great catastrophes and failures in the first half of the 20th century, Germany can always rely on its people will and strength to be among the greatest and powerful nations in the world.
startIntroPart2: Great Prince Bismarck, glory and power are at the heart of the German nation. Your people are bright, and lend you their iron will to lead Germany once again. Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: I cannot wait until ye grow even mightier. Therefore, prepare for war!
attacked: Corrupted villain! We will bring you into the ground!
defeated: Germany has been destroyed. I weep for the future generations.
denounced: That boldness is risky, especially if you lack the strength to back it up.
introduction: Guten Tag. In the name of the great German people, I bid you welcome.
tradeRequest: It would be in your best interest, to carefully consider this proposal.
uniques: When conquering an encampment, earn [75] Gold and recruit a Barbarian unit <with [100]% chance>
[-25]% maintenance costs <for [Land] units>

name: Iroquois
startIntroPart1: Greetings, noble Hiawatha, leader of the mighty Iroquois nations! Your people lived near the great and holy lake Ontario since the ancient ages, on a land that will be later known as New York city. Long ago, the five peoples of Seneca, Onondaga, Mohawks, Cayugas and Oneida became one nation, the Haudenosaunee, the Iroquois. Although not having a written language, the wise Iroquois created the Great Law of Peace, which can be considered the first established constitution. For decades, your people fought powerful enemies, such as the Huron, and then the French and English colonists. With less warriors and inferior weaponry, the Iroquois still survived and walk on the path of peace and harmony, until their way of living faded away under the crush of the newborn United States nation.
startIntroPart2: Great Sachem Hiawatha, do you hear the complaints of your people? Can you light the path leading to the ancient Iroquois union? Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: You are a plague upon Mother Earth! Prepare for battle!
attacked: You evil creature! My braves will slaughter you!
defeated: You have defeated us... but our spirits will never be vanquished! We shall return!
denounced: Go back to the shadows, you fool.
introduction: Greetings, stranger. I am Hiawatha, speaker for the Iroquois. We seek peace with all, but we do not shrink from war.
tradeRequest: Does this trade work for you, my friend?
uniqueText:
All units move through Forest and Jungle Tiles in friendly territory as if they have roads. These tiles can be used to establish City Connections upon researching the Wheel
+15% strength and double movement to [Military] [Land] units in [Forest]
May grow [Forest] without [Fertilizer]
uniques: All units move through Forest and Jungle Tiles in friendly territory as if they have roads. These tiles can be used to establish City Connections upon researching the Wheel.
[{Military} {Land}] units gain the [Of The Land] promotion <hidden from users>

name: Japan
startIntroPart1: Blessings upon you, noble Oda Nobunaga, ruler of Japan, the land of the Rising Sun! May you long walk among its flowering blossoms. The Japanese are an island people, proud and pious with a rich culture of arts and letters. Your civilization stretches back thousands of years, years of bloody warfare, expansion and isolation, great wealth and great poverty. In addition to their prowess on the field of battle, your people are also immensely industrious, and their technological innovation and mighty factories are the envy of lesser people everywhere.
startIntroPart2: Legendary damiyo, will you grab the reins of destiny? Will you bring your family and people the honor and glory they deserve? Will you once again pick up the sword and march to triumph? Will you build a civilization that stands the test of time?
declaringWar: I hereby inform you of our intention to wipe out your civilization from this world.
attacked: Pitiful fool! Now we shall destroy you!
defeated: You were much wiser than I thought.
introduction: We hope for a fair and just relationship with you, who are renowned for military bravery.
tradeRequest: I would be grateful if you agreed on the following proposal.
uniques: No damage penalty for wounded units <for [All] units>
[+1 Culture] from every [Fishing Boats]
[+2 Culture] from every [Atoll]

name: Lithuania
startIntroPart1: Blessings be upon you, Grand Duke of Lithuania, Vytautas the Great. It was your majesty that defeated the Golden Horde, ending forever the Mongol's ambitions about Europe. The Lithuanian Empire survived two centuries of the religious crusades, lead by the Teutonic order, finally striking down her great rival at the Battle of Žalgiris. The Duchy officially adopted Christianity with the Union of Krewo, signed by your traitorous brother Jogaila in 1386. Despite losing political and cultural solidarity, Lithuania was finally restored to sovereignity in the twentieth century.
startIntroPart2: The path of glory is calling you, Vytautas, Son of the Forest, baptised into the Church of Christ. Will you lead your people in the name of holiness? Will you create the Empire your people have always deserved? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: May this be a war for the ages!
attacked: History will only remember you as an usurper!
defeated: We will never bow to you, let alone to your Gods!
introduction: Ah, you have caught me just as I was going off to hunt. Stay for the feast, so we may know each other better!
tradeRequest: This day shall mark a betterment for our dominions' relations, I am sure of that.
uniqueText:
All Pantheon bonuses are doubled
Your cities are immune to all forms of religion spread
May buy [Krivis] units for 600 [Faith] [in all cities] at an increasing price starting from the Medieval era
uniques: [-999]% Natural religion spread [in all cities] <hidden from users>
May buy [Krivis] units for [600] [Faith] [in all cities] at an increasing price ([500]) <starting from the [Medieval era]> <hidden from users>

name: Mamluks
startIntroPart1: Marhaba, great al-Mustansir, of the emergent Mamluk Sultanate!
startIntroPart2: Show them who rules the desert!
declaringWar: God wills it
attacked: May God have mercy on you, for I will not
defeated: I'll see you in the afterlife
introduction: Greetings!
hateNo: We are not agreeing to that!
tradeRequest: We bestow you the honor of this trade offer.

Cost of purchasing land units -33%
All units gain +50% XP

[+50]% XP gained from combat

name: The Netherlands
startIntroPart1: Greetings to the wise and brave Prince William of Orange, who freed the Netherlands and gave strength to the Dutch people. In 1568, you led a rebellion against Spanish dominion, to gain freedom for your people, and therefore starting the Eighty Years' War. Your actions were all aimed to create one of Europe's first modern republics, the Seven United Provinces. The rebellion was the meaning of your very life and death, as it was also the cause of your assassination in 1584. But your death has given even more pride and courage to your people, to fight for liberty against any oppressors. Carved in history as the 'Father of the Fatherland', your name is a symbol of Dutch independence for eternity.
startIntroPart2: Brave Prince, your people ask for your wisdom to gain its freedom once more, and to illuminate the world with progressive and modern ideas. Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: As much as I despise war, I consider it a, hahaha, contribution to the common cause to erase your existence.
attacked: You call yourself an exalted ruler, but I see nothing more than a smartly dressed barbarian!
defeated: My God, be merciful to my soul. My God, feel pity for this... my poor people!
introduction: I am William of Orange, stadtholder of The Netherlands. Did you need anything? I still have a lot to do.
tradeRequest: I believe I have something that may be of some importance to you.
uniques: Retain [50]% of the happiness from a luxury after the last copy has been traded away
[50]% of excess happiness converted to [Gold]
[+2 Gold] [in all coastal cities]
[+2 Happiness] [in all coastal cities] <starting from the [Renaissance era]>

name: Norway
startIntroPart1: Harald Hardrada, the last great Viking warrior-king, your name echoes through the ages. From your early days as a mercenary in the Byzantine Empire to your rise as King of Norway, your life has been a testament to strength, cunning, and unyielding ambition. Your campaigns have set the stage for a new era of Norse dominance. The winds of fate howl through the fjords, calling you to greatness once more.
startIntroPart2: The Great King of Norway, The Thunderbolt of the North, your people call upon you once more. Will you lead them to glory as you did in the battles of Stiklestad and Niså? Can you reclaim the throne of England and show the world the true power ? Will you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Now comes a storm you cannot escape. You can only hope for a quick death! To victory! To Odin's halls!
attacked: This will make a great saga! The skalds will sing of my valor! Let us see if the same will go to you!
defeated: Joke's on you. I will join the einherjar in Valhalla and feast, while you toil away here.
introduction: Harald Sigurdsson stands before you: a Viking unlike any the seas and lands have ever known. Hah, are you afraid?
hateHello: Your seas are unprotected, friend. All too easy to raid.
tradeRequest: I have sent you traders with gifts of rune stones. They are powerful. I mean, the stones, not the traders.
uniques: [+1 Faith] from every [Water resource]
[+2 Food, +1 Production] from every [Snow]

name: Papal States
startIntroPart1: Kneel before Urban II, Pope of Christendom and voice of the First Crusade. Your call stirred kings and knights to reclaim the Holy Land, forging unity from chaos beneath the cross.
startIntroPart2: Holy Father, shall your call once more shake the world? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Your heresy must end. If not with words, then with swords.
attacked: You raise arms against the Holy See. May God judge you swiftly.
defeated: Hellfire, dark fire. Now it's my turn.
introduction: Welcome to the Holy See, the seat of the Papacy. I am Urban II, servant of God and shepherd of His flock.
neutralHello: Peace be upon you, if peace you truly seek. What cause brings you to Rome?
hateHello: You wear civility like a mask. Heaven sees what lies beneath.
tradeRequest: Let us unite not only in faith, but in commerce. Trade honors God and strengthens peace.
uniqueText:
Starts with [Piety] adopted
May choose 1 additional beliefs of any type when [enhancing] a religion

+25% [Faith], -25% [Gold] in all cities starting from the [Medieval] era
Resting point with all City-States following your religion +10

name: Persia
startIntroPart1: Great King Darius of Persia, the heaven casts its light upon you! Persian people are strong and wise, as their leader. In old ages, the great Persian king Cyrus fought back the mighty Median empire and finally destroyed the Medes in 550 BC. Cunning diplomacy and military achievements helped then to conquer the wealthy Lydia and the powerful Babylon, Cyrus' son conquering the eternal Egypt some years later. At the height of its power, the Persian Empire reached the shores of Macedonia, at the very door of the upstart Greek city-states. Persia would have prospered for centuries if Alexander of Macedon hadn't brutally destroyed the great empire in one violent strike.
startIntroPart2: King Darius, the people of Persia await, longing for its past glory and power! Persia of the Immortals must reborn, to punish its foes and rebuild the gleaming Persepolis! Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: Your continue existence is an embarrassment to all leaders everywhere! You must be destroyed!
attacked: Curse you! You are beneath me, son of a donkey driver! I will crush you!
defeated: You mongrel! Cursed be you! The world will long lament your heinous crime!
introduction: Peace be on you! I am Darius, the great and outstanding king of kings of great Persia... but I suppose you knew that.
tradeRequest: In my endless magnanimity, I am making you this offer. You agree, of course?
uniques: [+50]% Golden Age length
[+1] Movement <for [All] units> <during a Golden Age>
[+10]% Strength <for [All] units> <during a Golden Age>

name: Portugal
startIntroPart1: Blessings be upon you, most gracious Queen Maria, protector and sovereign of the Portuguese people. As the first ever Queen regnant of Portugal, it was your wise stewardship that protected the royal court from the incursions of Napoleon, establishing a safe haven in Brazil to preserve the integrity of Portuguese rule. Despite struggling with illness throughout your reign, your effort to ensure Portugal's close cooperation with Brazil are credited with helping that state gain its eventual independence - and for this you will always be admired and respected by the people of both nations.
startIntroPart2: Oh noble and pious queen, will you once again guide the kingdom of Portugal in the spirit of cooperation and prosperity? Will you establish a new legacy, one that will surpass all those who come before you? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: I'm afraid I cannot allow your kingdom to exist for much longer! I hope you won't mind...
attacked: You cannot be serious!
defeated: I know little about this conflict...I'll have to consult my regent...
introduction: I am Maria, Queen of Portugal! Have we met before? You look familiar to me... Or maybe not.
tradeRequest: Will you consider this offer?
uniques: Comment [Water units may heal outside of friendly territory]
[Water] units gain the [Supply] promotion <hidden from users>
[+1] Happiness from each type of luxury resource
[+1] Happiness from each type of luxury resource <starting from the [Renaissance era]>

name: Rome
startIntroPart1: Ave Caesar Augustus, Emperor of Rome and Dominus of the Roman Empire! Your empire was the most powerful and feared of all in Western civilization. The Roman people crafted so brilliantly its culture, law, art, and warfare, that no one could contest the supremacy of Rome. Force and Honor led to glorious conquests, a domination of all the lands from Spain in the west to Syria in the east, even reaching the remote barbarian lands of England and Germany. Roman art and architecture have been praised for millenia and have been envied by all lesser civilizations who have followed.
startIntroPart2: O glorious Imperator, your people celebrate you and ask for the glory of Rome! In these times of darkness, the Pax Romana will be a beacon of light for all! Will your new empire shine through the ages of history?
declaringWar: My treasury contains little and my soldiers are getting impatient... (sigh) ...therefore you must die.
attacked: So brave, yet so stupid! If only you had a brain similar to your courage.
defeated: The gods have deprived Rome of their favour. We have been defeated.
denounced: I didn't believe you had this kind of backbone.
introduction: I greet you. I am Augustus, Imperator and Pontifex Maximus of Rome. If you are a friend of Rome, you are welcome.
tradeRequest: I offer this, for your consideration.
uniques: [+25]% Production towards any buildings that already exist in the Capital
[+50]% [Gold] from Trade Routes
[-33]% maintenance on road & railroads

name: Tibet
startIntroPart1: Welcome Songtsen Gampo, manifestation of the Avalokiteśvara, first of the three great Dharma Kings, founder of the Tibetan Empire and leader of a hardy and enlightened people. Your reign of 34 years brought change never before seen to the Himalayas, as you united the Sumpa, Zhangzhung and Qiang tribes, brought Mahayana Buddhism to your people and constructed the Jokhang, heart of Lhasa. Your minister Thonmi Sambhota too created the Tibetan Script and Classical Tibetan, which was the first written and spoken language of Tibet.
startIntroPart2: Enlightened Leader, shall you again guide your people with balance and vision, to defend the mountains which scrape the heavens and the people who find it in themselves and others? Can you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
declaringWar: Karma finds all. There will be peace - in time.
attacked: You act with violence where there could have been stillness. Regret will follow.
defeated: I leave not in anger, but in sorrow. Even in loss, the Dharma continues.
introduction: Welcome, mighty leader.
neutralHello: Peace to you, traveler. May your words reflect clarity, not chaos.
hateHello: I sense stormclouds beneath your voice. You bring more trouble than enlightenment.
tradeRequest: Let our merchants walk the Path of Peace and bring wealth to both our mountain realms.
uniqueText:
Land units may cross [Mountain] tiles after the first [Great Prophet] is earned
[All] units gain double movement in [Hill], [Mountain]
Civilian units take no damage from ending turn in [Mountain]
[Melee]/[Ranged] units gain +10%/+8% strength in and per adjacent [Mountain], +5%/+4% strength in and per adjacent [Hill] and takes 10/15 damage from ending turn in [Mountain]
Ranged units heal 0 HP in [Mountain] tiles
uniques: Land units may cross [Mountain] tiles after the first [Great Prophet] is earned
[Land] units gain the [Tibetan Mountain Ability] promotion
[Melee] units gain the [Tibetan Melee Ability] promotion
[Ranged] units gain the [Tibetan Ranged Ability] promotion

name: Timurids
startIntroPart1: Tremble before Timur, the Scourge of Asia, whose armies toppled kingdoms and left pyramids of skulls. Your ruthless genius brought fear and glory from Delhi to Damascus.
startIntroPart2: Timur, will you again conquer with unmatched fury? Or shall your empire now stand the test of time through something greater?
declaringWar: Mercy is not one of my weapons. Prepare for ruin.
attacked: You've made your choice. Now I shall make your cities kneel.
defeated: When I rise from the dead, the world shall tremble
introduction: Hello, I am Timur, the Conqueror. My empire was vast, but my ambition was greater.
neutralHello: Speak now, while I still consider words more valuable than war.
hateHello: Your arrogance is vast—like my empire once was. Time to reduce both.
tradeRequest: Trade is the breath between wars. Speak your terms swiftly, before I change my mind.
uniqueText:
No growth penalty while above -10 [Happiness]
No combat and [Production] penalty while between -10 and -20 [Happiness]
Cannot build [Settler] units while below 0 [Happiness]
Upon capturing a city, receive 4 times its [Production] as [Golden Age points]
uniques: [+150]% growth [in all cities] <when between [-10] and [-1] [Happiness]>
[+100]% [Production] [in all cities] <when between [-11] and [-20] [Happiness]>
[+66]% Strength <for [All] units> <when between [-11] and [-20] [Happiness]>
Cannot build [Settler] units <when below [0] [Happiness]>
Upon capturing a city, receive [4] times its [Production] production as [Golden Age points] immediately
Instantly gain [1] [Skull Pyramids] <upon conquering a city>

name: Manama
declaringWar: You leave us no choice. War it must be.
attacked: Very well, this shall not be forgotten.
defeated: Perhaps now we will find peace in death...
